îˆƒThe Cloudflare tutorial on creating fine-tuned OpenAI models with R2 provides a comprehensive guide to integrating Cloudflare Workers, R2 object storage, and the OpenAI API to build custom AI applications.îˆ„îˆ†

Overview

îˆƒThis tutorial demonstrates how to:îˆ„îˆ†

  1. îˆƒCreate a Cloudflare Worker application.îˆ„
  2. îˆƒUpload a fine-tuning dataset to R2.îˆ„
  3. îˆƒBind the R2 bucket to your Worker.îˆ„
  4. îˆƒInitialize your Worker application using the Hono framework.îˆ„
  5. îˆƒRead files from R2 and upload them to OpenAI.îˆ„
  6. îˆƒCreate fine-tuned models via the OpenAI API.îˆ„
  7. îˆƒList all fine-tune jobs.îˆ„
  8. îˆƒDeploy your application.îˆ„
  9. îˆƒView the fine-tune job status and use the model.îˆ„îˆ†

Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:

  • îˆƒA Cloudflare account with access to R2.îˆ„
  • îˆƒAn OpenAI API key.îˆ„
  • îˆƒA fine-tune document structured as JSON Lines.îˆ„îˆ†

Key Steps

1. Create a Worker Application

îˆƒUse the c3 CLI to scaffold a new Cloudflare Workers project:îˆ„îˆ†

îˆƒnpm create cloudflare@latest -- finetune-chatgpt-modelîˆ„
îˆƒcd finetune-chatgpt-modelîˆ„

îˆ†

îˆƒChoose the "Hello World Starter" template with TypeScript.îˆ„îˆ†

2. Upload a Fine-Tune Document to R2

îˆƒCreate an R2 bucket and upload your fine-tune dataset:îˆ„îˆ†

îˆƒnpx wrangler r2 bucket create <BUCKET_NAME>îˆ„
îˆƒnpx wrangler r2 object put <PATH> -f <FILE_NAME>îˆ„

îˆ†

îˆƒReplace <BUCKET_NAME>, <PATH>, and <FILE_NAME> with your specific details.îˆ„îˆ†

3. Bind Your Bucket to the Worker

îˆƒUpdate your wrangler.toml file to bind the R2 bucket:îˆ„îˆ†

îˆƒ[[r2_buckets]]
binding = 'MY_BUCKET'
bucket_name = '<YOUR_BUCKET_NAME>'îˆ„

îˆ†

4. Initialize Your Worker Application

îˆƒInstall the Hono framework and OpenAI Node API library:îˆ„îˆ†

îˆƒnpm install hono openaiîˆ„

îˆ†

îˆƒReplace the contents of src/index.ts with the provided code in the tutorial, ensuring you replace <MY_BUCKET> with your binding name.îˆ„îˆ†

5. Read R2 Files and Upload Them to OpenAI

îˆƒImplement functionality in your Worker to read the fine-tune document from R2 and upload it to OpenAI using their API.îˆ„îˆ†

6. Create Fine-Tuned Models

îˆƒUse the OpenAI API to create a new fine-tuned model based on your uploaded dataset.îˆ„îˆ†

7. List All Fine-Tune Jobs

îˆƒImplement a route in your Worker to list all fine-tune jobs, allowing you to monitor their status.îˆ„îˆ†

8. Deploy Your Application

îˆƒDeploy your Worker application using Wrangler:îˆ„îˆ†

îˆƒnpx wrangler deployîˆ„

îˆ†

9. View the Fine-Tune Job Status and Use the Model

îˆƒAfter deployment, you can view the status of your fine-tune jobs and utilize the fine-tuned model in your applications.îˆ„îˆ†

For detailed instructions and code examples, refer to the full tutorial on the Cloudflare Developers website: îˆ€linkîˆ‚turn0search0îˆ.

If you need assistance with any specific step or have questions about customizing this setup for your project, feel free to ask!
